summary: A letter addressed to Judge Torres alleging that the FBI and OIG are withholding interview records related to inmate Lopez, who witnessed the destruction of documents by a Bureau of Prisons 'after actions team' investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death. The writer claims to be a whistleblower working at MCC NY and requests legal protections.

persons.name: Judge Torres
persons.context: Addressee of the letter regarding the withholding of interview records and alleged document destruction related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Inmate (S. 15934-014) who witnessed the shredding of large amounts of documents by the BOP 'after actions team' investigating Epstein's death and was interviewed by agents.

persons.name: Correction Officer
persons.context: Reported the shredding incident to OIG agent via email; mentioned alongside inmate Lopez.

persons.name: OIG Agent
persons.context: Received an email report from a Correction Officer about the document shredding; implied to potentially be involved in a cover-up.

persons.name: SIS Lt.
persons.context: Interviewed inmate Lopez on the 3rd floor of MCC NY along with other agents.

connections.description: Correction Officer reported the shredding witnessed by inmate Lopez to OIG via email.
SIS Lt. interviewed inmate Lopez regarding the document destruction he witnessed.
Correction Officer reported the shredding incident to an OIG agent via email.

events.title: Lopez Witnesses Document Shredding
events.description: Inmate Lopez declares 'they are shredding everything' regarding the destruction of records by the BOP 'after actions team' at MCC NY.

events.title: Continued Document Shredding
events.description: Inmate Lopez again reports ongoing shredding of documents by the BOP team.

events.title: Interview of Inmate Lopez
events.description: Inmate Lopez is interviewed on the 3rd floor of MCC NY by agents and SIS Lt. regarding the witnessed document destruction.

events.title: Report to OIG
events.description: Correction Officer sends an email to an OIG agent reporting the shredding of documents witnessed by inmate Lopez.

locations: MCC NY (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Inmate Lopez witnessed the shredding of large amounts of documents by a Bureau of Prisons 'after actions team' sent to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The document destruction allegedly occurred in the Warden's complex area at MCC NY and was reported to an OIG agent by a Correction Officer via email.
The writer alleges the government is withholding FBI and OIG interview records related to inmate Lopez and the Correction Officer to protect their prosecution.
The writer identifies as a whistleblower working at MCC NY and requests legal protections, expressing distrust in reporting to OIG due to potential cover-up.
